text: It is very important for the climate scientists, and the public in general, to understand the true effect of CO2 on global warming.. Although CO2 can absorb long wave thermal radiation, it can not block the heat radiation, and its capacity of trapping heat is very limited due to its low specific heat capacity. In addition, due to CO2's very low concentration in the atmosphere, the majority of the thermal radiation would escape to outer space without hit any GHG molecules. People need to rethink how the earth keeps its warmth and prevents from overheating in the same time. It is actually the entire atmosphere that retains the heat energy to keep the earth warm. Since the majority gases in the air do not absorb long wave thermal radiation, they can only get their heat energy through conduction and convection. And the stored heat in the air also shields the thermal radiation flux from the earth‚Äôs surface! The effect of CO2 in global warming is actually neglectable!

author: Dundoril

text:
"Heat capacity is 100% irrelevant " is only true if the hypothesis of the green house effect (to keep the earth warm) is only caused by those so called green house gases is true! In fact, the dominant green house effect that keeps earth warm comes from its entire atmosphere, or more specifically, the heat retaining capacity of all gases in the atmosphere. The earth can not further lost its heat energy when the surface temperature is equal or below the temperature of its surrounding air. This is what I referred to as ‚Äúthermal radiation shield‚Äù as it stops all heat transfer from the surface of Earth to outer space, once the temperature of the surface falls below the ambient air temperature. 



Because the air temperature and the thermal energy it holds controls the heat radiation from Earth to outer space, the heat capacity of each gas in the air matters a great deal. 

Thank you for your interest and critiques.
author: J J

text:
¬†@J J¬† I mean your alternative kind of physics is rather amusing, but not really relevant here. 

1. Heat capacity would still be irrelevant... The direction of netto energy transfer from one object to another is temperature dependend but not dependent on the total amount of energy stored. 
2. Air temperature are in general not equal or higher than surface temperature.... Mainly because it's the surfacr which absorbs most of the energy of the photon hitting the earth 
3. From which paper did you get this "heat shielding" Hypothesis?
author: Dundoril

text:
¬†@Dundoril¬†  -Indeed  the science behind climate change is the physics of thermodynamics. Let‚Äôs examine the relevant laws of heat transfer and energy balance.

1. Heat can only flow from high temperature to low temperature. I agree with your statement in your point 1, except for ‚ÄúHeat capacity. ..‚Äù. Once temperature is equalized, heat flow (net ) stops.



2. The heat radiation flux from the earth‚Äôs surface is given by the Stefan Boltzmann Law as follows,

F = C*(T1^4-T2^4)

Where C is a constant coefficient, T1 is the temperature of the earth‚Äôs surface, T2 is the ambient air temperature, all in K (not C or F). You can see clearly from the heat radiation equation the heat flux radiated from earth‚Äôs surface is  greatly reduced by the surrounding air temperature. This is what I referred to as ‚Äúshielding ‚Äú effect of the atmosphere, which is the true green house effect.



As CO2 only counts for 0.04% of the entire atmosphere, it‚Äôs ‚Äúgreenhouse effect‚Äù is very limited, as over 99.96% of heat radiation from earth‚Äôs surface (which is already shielded) will escape to outer space without hitting any GHG molecules.



Finally, based on this more realistic atmosphere ‚Äúgreenhouse‚Äù model, heat capacity of the air is much relevant. It directly explains why the heat wave occurred recently in the north of pacific coast, and why the record heat temperatures on earth only occurs in desserts, all has nothing to do with CO2 or any other GHS!


The common feature among those places where extreme hot temperature occurred is stagnant, and very dry air. Since dry air has much lower heat capacity, it can be heated up rapidly! From Stefan Boltzmann equation, the higher the air temperature, the more heat it will trap!
author: J J

text:
¬†@J J¬† You rather odd interpretation of the Stefan boltzmann in this case needs more time then I have today, but I will respond tomorrow.. 
But two quick points:
0.04% does not mean that 99.6% of photons will not see any GHG molecols. 
The areal density of the gas is the important factor there. Which is the amount of CO2 (or other greenhouses gases) per m2. 

Humidity is relative
A desert at 40 C and and 20% humidity (not uncommon for the Mojave Desert for example

)  will hold 0.01 kg and water per 1 kg of air. The same values are roughly reached at 20 degrees and 50-60% relative humidity... 
So the amount of water in the air in deserts it's not necessarily much lower than in other places. Neither is heat capacity

Your theory also  would mean that desert should keep their temperature rather stable at night... Which they don't
author: Dundoril

text:
¬†@Dundoril¬†‚ÄúOdd‚Äù from the view point of the GHG based global warming theory, which ignores the actual heat trapping effect of the atmosphere. The  actual radiated heat loss is much less than that assumed in the GHG model. as shown by the Stefan boltzmann equation.

You got your point on the percentage of photon escape to outer space without hitting any GHG molecule, which indeed depends on the projected density, instead of concentrations. However it appears the consensus of climate scientists already did the calculation and found the density of all GHG is so high that no phonon would escape, i.e 100% of radiation would be absorbed by the GHG‚Äôs with its current concentration. If this is true, it means the ‚Äúgreen house effect‚Äù of the existing GHG‚Äôs reaches to its peak. Any additional GHG would then have no effect on blocking the heat radiation from the earth.

text: I'm not saying that CO2 emissions do not affect the climate temperature, but why do I feel like people do not look at other factors? Why do we automatically assume that CO2 is the only factor? Can it be that CO2 might just be one of the hundreds of factors that causes climate change such as the sea, sun, earth rotation, etc., and that we actually don't really know how much humans contribute to climate change? Furthermore, it would be impossible to figure out what our spending of trillions of dollars, not driving cars, flying airplanes, etc., would accomplish in 20 years. I'm open to having my mind changed, but I don't see it as very reasonable and proportional to sacrifice my freedoms for something that we don't even know if it will make any difference - for a problem that we don't really know why it came to be.

text:
I think the best solution is to give the people of the world something good to invest in that is secure and pays a great dividend. The developed nations of the world could provide backing and guarantees for an "Earth Bond" that pays 8% annual inflation-adjusted dividends with no limit to the guarantee and no ownership limit like was in place with war bonds. The bond funds would only be used for 2 purposes: 1) projects to improve the health of our planet.
2) provide employment, benefits and fair compensation to the world's poor
Essentially you would employ the world's poor to improve the health of the planet and give plenty of incentive for everyone to invest in these endeavors through a guaranteed annual 8% inflation-adjusted dividend. Everybody wins and nobody feels like they were "taken from" like through taxation that never works.

text:
Here is the absolute scam that is AGW narrative in scientific terms.
And BTW arctic sea ice reached its so called minimum almost 10 years ago although polar ice caps are the exception in earth climate history not the norm.

Co2 in the atmosphere is a trace  gas, just 410 parts per million, that is 0.00041 of atmosphere.
Of that Co2 a tiny fraction can attributed to manmade Co2, even taking the high figure of warmists it is just 3% of total Co2
3% of 0.00041 is 0.0000123% manmade Co2 as percentage of the atmosphere.
The UK accounts for just 1% of global Co2 output of that manmade carbon which makes UK atmospheric Co2 contributions in total 0.000000123% of atmosphere.
Zero Co2 emissions from the UK will reduce atmospheric Co2 by a maximum of 0.000000123% over centuries.
That is one Billionth of one percent!
Meanwhile China is responsible for more Co2 emissions than the whole Europe and US combined but still has no carbon taxes imposed on it.

Further we are told atmospheric Co2 is at record levels yet for the vast majority of Earths life giving history it has been much higher.
This is why they never show Co2 on the geological scale as it would show the atmosphere is Co2 starved and totally debunk the pseudo science runaway warming propaganda.
For example, in the Cambrian period that gave is renowned for being the period that life most flourished on earth, Co2 levels were 20 times higher than now!
This continued through hundreds of millions years and far from the earth dying it was green and temperate from pole to pole.

I could give a lecture on how the greatest Co2 producing nations  outside the West were left exempt of all climate policy (How strange when the Earth is allegedly about to die?)

text: Yes, there are a lot of natural components that influence our climate. However, this doesn't mean that human activity can't influence the climate.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Human activity can influence microclimates but it cannot facilitate the whole atmosphere-all 5 layers up to orbit. But a good part of this is called entropy & one cannot avoid the 2nd law of thermodynamics. While certainly politicians do not want us to have cars or use jets & apparently not use a furnace, they themselves will not make that sacrifice. They have rested their argument into this: If A, then B. So they begin w/ the premise that CO2 is bad. Yet since the industrial rev. societies have progressed by allowing us to have light to see, ac to keep cool, heat to keep warm, the ability to cook, the ability to run electric currents. They want us back in the Stone Age under a false guise that the planet is in jeopardy. This is a charade for carbon markets. While certainly the world's population is much larger, don't forget not everyone has or uses a car-typically the very poor regions of the world. Likewise not every region of the world requires a furnace-Africa, SE Asia, Oceania, a good part of South America, & the southern countries of the Eurasian belt. So given that the whole world is not putting out a lot of CO2  as it relates to using furnaces for heat.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
And how exactly does entropy make AGW impossible? 
WOW, are you saying that some politicians are hypocrites? That never happened before. What is your point? Scientific facts don't change because of your feelings about hypocritical politicians.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† I think you're the one running on emotion as politicians do. I have the science background to critically reason; you don't. You're simply one of the trolls out there to promote the alarmism.  Entropy is defined as the trend toward any energy-producing process or any metabolic process toward disorder, chaos. waste energy-aka heat. The simplest example is a lightbulb-a device designed to process light energy. After a few minutes of being lit, that energy is not 100% efficient. There is a loss--called entropy-this energy is lost in the form of heat.  Similar with a distance runner, most of the ATP production does not go to mechanical motion; it is channeled out in the form of waste heat. What occurs when the body has waste heat--it sweats. It only cools with the evaporation of that sweat. Yet another example, did you know that T-Storms & hurricanes are nature's ways of ridding the planet of entropy.  The entropy buildup induced by the sun's radiation over a differentiated surface.
author: Kim Libera

text:
‚Äã¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
And what scientific background do you exactly have? If you claim that you are the one that can critically reason and I don't, it would be painful if I can refute your reasoning. You can explain what entropy is, but that doesn't prove your point. I know what entropy and the second law of thermodynamics are. In no way or form do they make AGW impossible. If you want to try to prove otherwise: do it and not by just stating some concepts. 

And why am I running on emotions? I'm not discussing the behaviour of politicians like you do, nor am I using an ad hominem. You are the one that is using fallacies in your reasoning.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Look Yrax-you're a troll that is doing the bidding of these industries. I can tell. I have 3 degrees--MS in earth science, minor in geology. 110 credits across the earth science curriculum. Entropy indeed influences microclimates-that's why cities are complaining of heat buildup. But the fact of the matter is you are the one that just buys into this stuff & believes much like the Holy See did in Galileo time, that mankind just got to be the center of attention. I'm well versed in my fields & I'm always exploring the podcasts & lit. produced by scientists who don't have a political agenda.

text: Scientists and the IPCC have known for years that CO2 has three climate change properties: one that warms (the greenhouse gas effect) and two that cool (the flora and aerosol effects). While there have been dozens of studies on the greenhouse gas effect, there have only been five on the total effect of CO2. All five concluded the same thing. CO2 cools more than it warms. The last study that included 62+ years of real-time records and hourly and monthly datasets from every international climate institute (NASA, NOAA, Berkeley, Hadley, York, World Meteorological Organization (Tokyo), RSS, UAH, and Mauna Loa Observatory found that the net effects of water vapor and methane force climate change. But, the total effect of CO2 (greenhouse, flora, and aerosol effects combined) is to anti-force climate. I really feel sorry for all the organizations that discounted flora and aerosol effects and the educators that now have to admit that they don't always teach what is real.

text: And N2 and O2 don't contribute anything to the greenhouse effect. If you dissolve a toxin in water, does it magically stops being toxic? Because that is the same reasoning you are using.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† CO2 is not a toxin-if you remember your chemistry. You have the media & a few groups trying to persuade the non-informational public that it is bad for civilization. But will any of you give your vehicles or heating sources or electric gadgets. You are using an IF A, THEN B logic. The ocean is the natural sink for CO2 absorption, hence the importance of oceans. You are assuming & assuming wrongly that CO2 in the ocean is somehow bad.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
 I know CO2 is not a toxin. I used your logic in a different situation. Your logic is simple: If the concentration is low it can't have an effect. I applied that logic on toxins to show the logic is flawed. O2 and N2 cannot absorb infrared radiation and thus don't play a role in the greenhouse effect. If you think that CO2 can't affect the global temperature because of its low concentration then what gasses do influence the climate? Or are you claiming there is no greenhouse effect and the average temperature is -20 degrees celsius? 

Yes, oceans take up CO2. They do this because CO2 in the oceans and in the atmosphere are in equilibrium. The oceans will thus only absorb a part of the CO2. The only thing oceans thus do is slow down the rise of atmospheric CO2. The absorption of CO2 in the ocean is problematic because it causes acidification. This could be quite devastating for marine life.

What is your point about giving vehicles, heating sources or electric gadgets?
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† My 1st point is to educate people on the %s that N2 & O2 comprise in the air column b/c if one listens to the media often enough they are mislead to think that CO2 comprises most of the atmosphere; also most school curriculums do not have earth science so I would not expect everyone to know this fact-but blame the education system. Next point, on my own channel I talk about the GH effect. The GH effect is a valid law in atmospheric science but I'm also making the point that it is light-be it in what we call waves or photons that drive the climate. A handful of gases do not a climate make. Meaning their effect is marginal relative to the whole planet & all the other physical processes. And the reason for this is again those particular gases do no comprise a huge % of the atmosphere-why you say?  It is because of the unique repositories we have on earth. Regarding the oceans-the oceans plus other water sinks absorb most of our CO2 b/c the oceans occupy 72% of the planet & they are rather deep. CO2 dissolves into the ocean. It can be used to produce carbonic acid. It's a natural process  Now let me point out what another blogger told me a couple weeks back. Mars has an atmosphere of 95% CO2 (I have not checked this out yet but assume so).  Why isn't it heating up at a runaway effect? It's not. Why-because there are many factors that affect weather. It just so happens that media & political giants want everyone to be persuaded to believe that CO2 is so bad that we should regress our technological progression. And that leads me to the last point. The public unable to critical reason on the issue--is it willing to sacrifice all the comforts & innovations it has gained over the last couple 100 years just because of the attention focused on this gas. So are you ready to give up your car, a jet vacation or a train ride? What about your furnace? Would you consider not using an oil furnace or natural gas furnace & maybe just pile up w/ lots of blankets. Tell that to the people who live at the top of Maine.  This is all political bunk.  Politiicans favor scare tactics to get peple to correspond to the desired behaviors they want. So in sum, yes the greenhouse gas is a valid property but its applicability in terms of a runaway effect is limited by the number of buffers. A particular gas is not the engine of climate.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
1) Sure, CO2 is a trace gas in the atmosphere. The thing you apparently don't know is that N2 and O2 don't contribute to the greenhouse effect because they don't absorb infrared radiation. Just like the toxicity doesn't change when you add water the effect of CO2 on the greenhouse effect isn't influenced by O2 and N2. You repeat this mistake when discussing Mars. Yes, 95% of the atmosphere of Mars is CO2 that doesn't mean there is a lot of CO2 on Mars. The reason the greenhouse effect of CO2 on Mars is limited is because of the extremely thin atmosphere. If I have one rock and one piece of gold and you have 10 pieces of gold an a 10000 rocks, who has more gold? Quite simple, you have. Even tho my rock gold percentage is way higher.  
2) Yes there is a carbon cyclus. The problem with a cyclus is is that it works in two ways. Yes, the ocean absords around 92 gigatons of carbon year. However it also releases 90 gigatons of it back into the atmosphere. The 2 gigatons difference indeed compensates partly for the burning of fossil fuels. However, there still is a net increase of carbon in the atmosphere. 
3) Do you think poverty is a problem? If so, are you ready to give away all of your income besides what you need as a bare minimum? So no holidays, no big house, no new car, no new clothes, etc.? This is just a absurd. So if you think climate change excists you need to give up your furnace?
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Yrax-I know N2/O2 are not greenhouse gases. The point I'm trying to make is that these are the 2 main components of air. CO2 is only 0.035% & it only participates at 4 specific IR w/l.  The other reason as you point out in the Mars example, is Earth, unlike Venus, does not possess the same atmo. pressure that exists on Venus. Venus is able to constrain this gas to its atmosphere b/c of the higher air pressure-see Dr. Richard Lindzen's podcast on this very topic.  Additionally, the Earth's carbon cycle is in balance. There have been no drastic changes to the earth. If you say pollution is significantly higher-yes-higher populations & esp higher populations that can't put their trash in a proper container. In spite of what you consider xtra carbon in the atmosphere, there has not been dramatic warming to cause panic. And don't forget, not everyone on the planet has or uses a car or takes a jet. Not every nation has need for heat to keep people warm. Much of the population lives in tropical regions where there is no need for a furnace.  In fact when you look at 2 large nations-e.g. Russia & Canada-these are the 2 that it would be expected to have to rely on heat in the winter. The difference is that Russia has much more population than Canada. But what would you have those people do-not use a furnace. That's absurd.  Poverty is not my problem. The whole purpose of the climate alarmism has nothing to do with bringing down the earth's temp or clearing pollution. It's all about carbon markets b/c govts have run out of ways to engineer an economy-aka-they cannot satiate their thirst for revenue. So they want to penalize entities for using X amount of carbon. But who will be the deciders? Certainly not the people. And what the public does not know is that the politicians don't want people in cars or trains or using furnaces but nothing will stop them from using their jets & their furnaces.  You really can't expect people in Duluth Minn to stay warm during the winter simply because they have to worry about what their oil furnace emits. Politicians have no earth science background.  Dig into Clive Best's webpage-he has a very strong understanding on CO2.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
Yes, CO2 is trace gas. And what is the point you are trying to make again? That because something is a trace gas it can't contribute to the greenhouse effect? So what molecules do contribute to the greenhouse effect? Because all the other greenhouse gasses are also trace gases. 

If the carbon cycle is in balance why do we have the highest CO2 concentration in at least the last 3 million years? 

So you don't think poverty exist and don't think it is a problem?  Of course, people in Russia and Canada should be using heating. You are simply using faulty logic by making a strawman argument.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Incorrect. You are the one using the strawman. How do you know the CO2 concentration at any point in the past-were you around then? Were you around in the Hadean & Archean Eras or the Proterozoic Era or the Carboniferous Periods.  Just the mere presence of a thing does not make it catastrophically alarmist. E.g. let's look at 2 things:  UV radiation & ozone.  Ozone (O3) absorbs UV radiation which as you know gives us a sunburn & skin cancer. This is b/c UV rays, being on the short end, have higher frequency & hence more energy laws written by Planck & Boltzmann. However, did you also know that one's vitamin D, a necessary vitamin for building immunity is made with the direct effect of UV rays. Another example.  volcanos. Are they  constructive or destructive? Well they are actually both. Depending on the type of volcano & type of eruption, if you live near one you could possibly be hit by hot debris, sustain smoke inhalation, or be caught in a hot lava flow. There are also possible hazards of noxious gases & cuts to the eye from glass.  However, much of the planet's land was created by the constructive effects of volcanos creating land (just watch films of Hawaii).  In fact, a new island is forming in the Hawaiian chain.  Currently a seamount.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
Proxy data is a thing. This is a stupid argument and you know it. We can quite accurately measure past CO2 concentrations. Are you also going to deny the movement of tectonic plates and evolution because we "weren't around"? 

Do you know what a strawman argument is? You are saying: "But what would you have those people do-not use a furnace. That's absurd. ". No one is saying that people in Canada or Russia should use a furnace or heating. You are making up an exaggeration instead of reacting to the actual arguments. You using that exaggeration to claim the argument I'm making is absurd. This is precisely what a strawman argument is. If you claim I made a strawman argument, point it out. 

I don't understand the relevance of vitamins and vulcanos.
author: YraxZovaldo

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† I'm an earth scientist, specialty geology. You are assuming CO2 is higher now b/c of all the attention Al Gore has brought to the issue. His claim is A, then B. The fact is when people make a claim of we have more CO2 than there ever has been-people are only relying on info being presented in the present. They are not aware Earth is 4.5 GA. And specifically the Hadean/Archaen Eras had much more CO2 than the period of the Industrial Revolution onward. You cannot measure the gigatons of the previous eons because we were not around back then. Remember we have a very deep ocean, we have a pretty atmosphere, & then there is the land & the rocks. I'm very well aware of plate tectonics; most of the public is not. They do not know that the land masses have moved around the globe & that ocean basins have opened & closed. BTW whenever there is radioactive decay & significant plate movement as in a seismic event, there is also the release of heat. See Gore's argument is he starts out w/ the premise that CO2 is bad & that he perceives a warming which in his mind must be caused by CO2 & must be catastrophic. Where he is wrong is CO2 follows any warming, not precedes it. Addtionally he is all wrapped in the carbon markets & his solar panels & his goal is just to get people to get into that. I'd say leave it up to the market & not congressmen. My point about the vitamins & the volcanos, again the media is pushing a cass that CO2 is so catastrophic for us-in fact john kerry was just saying that today that we have only a few years left. And I'm sitting here laughing. People think we're all going to suffocate or something. They don't know how to react to it. The point with vitamin D is that the awful piece of radiation known as UV also provides a beneficial effect in that this is what stimulates growth of it in the skin. No catastrophe.  Just like volcanos.  Often the source of many natural hazards, yet volcanos also create land crust for people to live on & many actual utilize the volcanic soils to grow things.  So my point is there is no need for alarmism. The system has buffers.
author: Kim Libera

text:
¬†@Kim Libera¬† 
How do you know that land masses have moved around the globe? We were not around back then?  Do you begin to notice the inconsistency in your argumentation? 

I'm not assuming that CO2 is higher now because of Al Gore. This way of making arguments is very annoying. I can also just keep on repeating that you only listen to big oil companies and believe what they say without any critical thought. That would however be untrue and a weak form of making an argument. So stop assuming that I believe CO2 is higher now because of Al Gore. 

"And specifically the Hadean/Archaen Eras had much more CO2 than the period of the Industrial Revolution onward. You cannot measure the gigatons of the previous eons because we were not around back then."
In sentence 2 you are saying that we can't measure historic CO2 levels and in sentence 1 you say we can? What is it? Make up your mind. 

I don't know what Kerry said. I don't care. There are also people claiming that the atmosphere has no influence on the climate and that it is only the sun and nothing else. So people saying a lot of stupid stuff. CO2 itself is not catastrophic but a changing climate can be quite a problem. The main problem is that you probably don't react to what people are saying. Can you point me out to someone who is saying that we are going to suffocate? Can you name a specific person? Because if you can't, you are making a strawman again.

author: Dominic Padillo

text: CO2 isn't an aerosol. Aerosols are particles suspended in a gas. The burning of fossil fuel indeed causes an increase in aerosols. Climate models take this into account and not just the 5 studies you are talking about.
author: YraxZovaldo

text:
¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Yes, CO2 by itself is not an aerosol. Commercial CO2 is associated with aerosols so must be analyzed with it. Also, models do not take aerosols into account (they make assumptions, which isn't the same). If they did take co-aerosols into account, the models would show that the aerosol effect neutralizes the greenhouse gas effect of CO2 for approximately 90 days. After that, all one sees is the powerful flora effect of CO2 overpowering the greenhouse gas effect and causing in total, significant anti-forcing. 
There are only 5 studies on the total effect of CO2--studies that focus only on the greenhouse gas effect, or aerosol effect, or flora effect, are not studying total effects. A model that makes assumptions is also not studying the total effect of CO2. It is only a study of the model.
author: WF Frantz

text:
¬†@WF Frantz¬† 
The powerful flora effect? What do you mean with that? It this studies one of your 5 studies? 
Huber, M., & Knutti, R. (2012). Anthropogenic and natural warming inferred from changes in Earth‚Äôs energy balance. Nature Geoscience, 5(1), 31-36.
author: YraxZovaldo

text:
¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† Thanks for asking. That study is from an Earth Energy Balance model of "simulations with an intermediate-complexity climate model". So not empirical evidence. More like commentary on commentary, thus scientifically of little value. 

High-value scientific evidence needs to be based on real-time actual measurements of our biosphere. This is how greenhouse gas properties of H2O and Methane were empirically supported--taking the greenhouse gas effect from a theory and lab tests to "yes, that is what happens in or actual atmosphere". The same level of scrutiny is how the flora anti-forcing property of CO2 was found to be stronger than CO2's greenhouse forcing property. 

Have you seen the empirical evidence presented in "CO2 Empirical Evidence" or "CO2 Physics" or "AGU 2020 - Evidence from Other Scientists" with links provided in othe of the other replies? I think they will answer your questions about the CO2 related flora effect and the other four studies. 

I appreciate your curiosity, skepticism, and open mind--all excellent traits of a scientist.
author: WF Frantz

text:
¬†@WF Frantz¬† I disagree with your point about simulations. This is empirical evidence. They look at the actual temperature data and see how much of the temperature can be explained by a bunch of variables. That simply is empirical evidence. 

I don't see a post with the empirical evidence. Channels often don't allow posts with links to external websites. These posts are only visible by you but not by other people. You can check if this is the case by opening this video while not logged in. You can also just post the reference (so authors, year, title and journal) and I can find the papers myself.

author: typedef04

text:
¬†@typedef04¬† CO2 is invisible so that doesn't influence if you could see the Himalaya or not. 
First of all, the atmosphere is complex. CO2 is continually exchanged between the atmosphere, oceans, plants, etc. So yes the exact effect of a few months of less CO2 emissions might not be extremely visible in the CO2 concentration. 
Secondly, if we simplify it, the CO2 concentration would only stop increasing if we would completely stop C02 emissions. We didn't. World wide CO2 emissions fell by 6.4% in 2020. That is not a very big change and that would be very hard to see on a graph.
author: YraxZovaldo

text:
¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† It is incorrect to say C02 is invisible. For human eye yes, for Satellites when it takes images in different spectrum is "visible".  Again, I mentioned it before   I brought Himalaya example only to show the magnitude of slowing emission.
 I disagree when production of C02 goes down total concentration is goes up. At least angle of increase has to change. It didn't.
author: typedef04

text: ¬†@typedef04¬† As nice as I am I looked at the data from NASA. The difference in CO2 levels between 15-2-2020 and 16-12-2020 was 1.5 ppm. The difference between 15-2-2019 and 16-12-2019 was 1.6 ppm. So the previous year there was a bigger increase in the same time span. Of course it is useless to zoom in to the data in such a manner, but you asked for it.

text: ¬†@YraxZovaldo¬† It looks like humans has no affect on trend.

text: ¬†@typedef04¬† There is 6.25% difference in the increase from that time period in 2019 and 2020. That is extremely close to the 6.4% drop in emissions in 2020. text:
This video is lies, it's ridiculous how the video has eliminated all of the real reasons for constant climate change.
The causes and effects of why climates change on our planet are as follows:
The Sun / Solar Cycles, 
The Hydrological Cycle,
The Coriolis Force,
The Milankovitch cycles, 
Kelvin Waves,
The thermohaline Cycle,
Geophysical / Volcanism,
The complicated interaction between all of these factors.

They should be sacked for pushing children to watch pseudo science propaganda videos.
Here is the absolute scam that is AGW narrative in scientific terms.
And BTW arctic sea ice reached its so called minimum almost 10 years ago although polar ice caps are the exception in earth climate history not the norm.

Co2 in the atmosphere is a trace  gas, just 410 parts per million, that is 0.00041 of atmosphere.
Of that Co2 a tiny fraction can attributed to manmade Co2, even taking the high figure of warmists it is just 3% of total Co2
3% of 0.00041 is 0.0000123% manmade Co2 as percentage of the atmosphere.
The UK accounts for just 1% of global Co2 output of that manmade carbon which makes UK atmospheric Co2 contributions in total 0.000000123% of atmosphere.
Zero Co2 emissions from the UK will reduce atmospheric Co2 by a maximum of 0.000000123% over centuries.
That is one Billionth of one percent!
Meanwhile China is responsible for more Co2 emissions than the whole Europe and US combined but still has no carbon taxes imposed on it.

Further we are told atmospheric Co2 is at record levels yet for the vast majority of Earths life giving history it has been much higher.
This is why they never show Co2 on the geological scale as it would show the atmosphere is Co2 starved and totally debunk the pseudo science runaway warming propaganda.
For example, in the Cambrian period that gave is renowned for being the period that life most flourished on earth, Co2 levels were 20 times higher than now!
This continued through hundreds of millions years and far from the earth dying it was green and temperate from pole to pole.

I could give a lecture on how the greatest Co2 producing nations  outside the West were left exempt of all climate policy (How strange when the Earth is allegedly about to die?)

Actually its a lot more than that. You're also looking at forced human migration,  more frequent droughts, more widespread tropical diseases. 

Overall, global warming will not make humanity go extinct. Our way of life, maybe. Only the wealthiest people would walk out of it relatively unscathed. 

How much time we got? Well, the current CO2 that we've added is not gonna go back down to preindustrial levels for over a 1000 years naturally. In that sense we're probably too late. We still have, at our current rate of emissions, about 10 years to go carbon neutral, and negative from there before the impact becomes civilisation threatning.

text:
I really feel sorry for these young kids, its so sad. However this is what you get for giving prizes out for coming last place!! Ask any of these climate change activists, simple basic questions about our planets climate and they have no idea. Here are some of the questions I ask them, when they get all high and mighty about it. Try it, it is fun. 

1.What greenhouse gas is largest in volume in Earths atmosphere? I have not had 1 person actually be able to answer this question correctly, it is hilarious.
Answer = Water Vapor / Clouds (Approx. 95% of all greenhouse gas present in Earths Atmosphere) 

2. What is the Milankovitch cycle and how does that effect the Earths climate? 
Answer = Eccentricity, Obliquity & Precession effect the average temperature on Earth over long periods of time. Based on real scientific data with accuracy measures in place, this can actually affect Earths temperature by plus or minus 10¬∞C over long periods.

We are so small us humans, we think we are so big, that is the real climate change issue. If you look up national geographic videos from the 70s & 80s, they were also very concerned with climate change, this was when they had recently confirmed that the Earth had been frozen over multiple times in the past, going back millions of years. They were worried that the Earth would become frozen again. Wouldn't it be really funny if we actually have to save the planet from being frozen over by pumping millions of tonnes of carbon into the air. The plants would love that....... Not many people know but most plants are actually CO2 deprived and use 3 to 4 times more water in this deprived state. The real issue is pollution and not climate change.  Climate change has been occurring for millions of years and will continue to occur for millions of years.

text:
most climate activists whine about how no change is being done without 
given any examples of what can be done. electric cars, florescent 
lightbulbs, solar panels, wave energy plants, even the clothes on your 
back require energy (oil) to be made. its so incredibly unrealistic to 
assume all eight billion people on the planet can switch over to some 
hippy, local trade, lifestyle. it will never happen, human civilization 
is too vast. most environmentalist are more corrupt than the 
corporations they persecute, always griping for more money without any 
thought of an endgame. humans arnt going to rollback on civilization 
like the mayans did, theres only a forward path. and that path is off 
planet, all the energy we will ever need is right here in the solar 
system. once we can find off world resources, only then earth can stop 
being farmed to death.

text: ¬†@Johan Alvarez¬† Stop repeating things without researching them. That makes you a parrot. Go do some research and you'll find out everything they told you was a lie. The Earth is historically cold right now, not historically hot. The polar bear population is booming, not going extinct. Extreme weather kills less people every decade and sea level rise is slowing, not speeding up. CO2 has almost nothing to do with the climate but it's a good excuse to control everything you do.

text: An example is clouds. As the incoming radiation from the sun increases, increased temperatures drive more water vapor into the air. Water vapor is even better at trapping heat than CO2 is. So if the water vapor stays transparent, you get warming. However, if the water vapor turns into clouds, they reflect incoming energy from the sun and cool the surface of the earth.

text: Looks like the greenhouse effect is an adiabatic (pressure-induced) process and therefore doesn't depend on the composition of the atmosphere. The CO2 concentration in the atmosphere is thus irrelevant to the greenhouse effect, because its concentration in the atmosphere doesn't affect the intensity of such effect. Here's the DOI code of such scientific paper: 10.4172/2573-458X.1000112

text:
¬†@Micheal Carney¬† As the paper states:
"The artificial decoupling between radiative and convective heat-transfer processes adopted in climate models leads to mathematically and physically incorrect solutions with regard to surface temperature"
"(...) convection (and especially the moist one) is orders of magnitude more efficient in transferring energy than LW radiation"
"(...) heat preferentially travels along the path of least resistance"
The Nikolov-Zeller PTE Effect theory completely accounts for why the Earth and other celestial bodies with an atmosphere are warmer than they would be without their atmospheres. It replaces the current "Greenhouse Gas Effect" (radiation decoupled from the quantum physics of elastic shock) hypothesis that has never been empirically proven in the last 190 years since it was first postulated.
Similar to the way a diesel engine's piston compresses gases creating pressure that enhances the existing heat in each cylinder to reach the temperature needed to ignite the fuel, the huge mass of the Earth's atmosphere's gas molecules being compressed by the natural pull of gravity provides the constant Pressure-induced Thermal Enhancement (PTE) of the available Solar Heat-Energy, which results in the PTE Greenhouse Effect that keeps our planet habitably warmer than it would be without an atmosphere (i.e. a global mean surface temperature of approximately 58¬∞F or 14¬∞C with our atmosphere, versus a global mean surface temperature below 0¬∞F or -17¬∞C without an atmosphere).
This study is orders of magnitude more precise than any IPCC study and report.
author: Yuri Sucupira

text: ¬†@Micheal Carney¬† In case you happen to be sincerely interested to know: no 97% study exists that shows 44,000 peer-reviewed papers explicitly endorsing AGW (Anthropic Global Warming). The largest study to date, Cook et al. (2013), attempted to categorize 11,944 abstracts [brief summaries] of papers (not entire papers) to their level of endorsement of AGW and found that 7,930 (66%) held no position on AGW, while only 64 papers (0.5%) explicitly endorsed and quantified AGW as +50% (humans are the primary cause). A later analysis by Legates et al. (2013) found there to be only 41 papers (0.3%) that supported such definition. Cook et al.'s methodology was so fatally flawed that they falsely classified skeptic papers as endorsing the 97% consensus, apparently believing to know more about the papers than their authors. The second part of Cook et al. (2013), the author self-ratings simply confirmed the worthlessness of their methodology, as they were not representative of the sample since only 4% of the authors (1,189 of 29,083) rated their own papers and, out of these, 63% disagreed with the abstract ratings. All the other "97% consensus" studies - e.g. Doran & Zimmerman (2009), Anderegg et al. (2010) and Oreskes (2004) - have been refuted by peer-reviews.
author: Yuri Sucupira

This means that over population is the problem. In the last 40 years the world population has doubled. So we need to DOUBLE the production of EVERYTHING, Literally! text:
One evening, while living in the Rio Grande Valley and helping my father cover his citrus trees to help protect them against a freeze predicted for later that night, I found myself hoping and praying for heavy overcast to replace the current clear skies. We‚Äôd never heard of the greenhouse effect at that time, but we knew that a blanket of clouds (water vapor) would slow down the escape of Earth‚Äôs heat.

My dad had already flooded the ground around the trees and prepped his smudge pots to be lit at the appropriate moment (for the blanketing effect of carbon laden air).

As the thermometer continued to slowly but surely drop, we nervously sat listening to the reports on the radio. Then, just as temperatures neared freezing, a bank of clouds moved in over the region and the rate of temperature decrease slowed and stopped at 30 degrees (F.). An hour later, the sun peeked over the horizon and very slowly the temperature began to rise. Damage to the fruit and trees was avoided without having lit the smudge pots.

My point is that even though some people may not believe in the greenhouse effect, they‚Äôre almost certainly not citrus growers.

text: The climate catastrophists make several fatal errors when they argue for their POV. 1. They are completely unskeptical about a subject which is very obviously controversial among climate scientists and earth scientists in general. There is no such thing as a partial consensus. Consensus is total or it is not consensus. Consensus is a matter of opinion, not scientific protocol for proof. Absolute conviction in a scientist is already suspicious, but when its about a controversial subject, that discredits them utterly. 2. They want to have us all believe that the trace of a trace gas that humans contribute to is the driver for a gigantic, chaotic system with enormous forces and thousands of contributing elements. They look at the entire past and present dynamics and imagine co2 everywhere. This is not science. 3. The scientists at the IPCC were caught red handed in the early 2000s cooking the graphs to make the past temperature record colder and steady. They should all have been fired, but were never punished. When Catastrophic AGW people make claims and use materials from the IPCC, they cannot be taken seriously. 4. The Catastrophists attempt to make co2 seem toxic. Co2 is not a toxin, any more than oxygen. Co2 is as vital to life on the planet as oxygen and water. 400 ppm is already homeopathic compared to periods in the past when it was 1000s of ppm and life was flourishing. 150 ppm is the level at which all life would and has died. At 400 ppm, the current global level is LOW. 600 is common under a forest canopy. 2k to 3k on a submarine or in the space station. Co2 is pumped into actual greenhouses at 1000s of ppm because it helps with photosynth and water uptake. Without Co2 we would not be able to digest or breathe. 5. They claim that the oil companies are holding back research and are buying off their opposition. Actually, the oil industry has its head down and is funding alternative energy research and giving a lot to the IPCC. The real catastrophy is the one these snake oil salesmen would instigate if they were successful at making everyone hysterical enough to panic. Not to mention the billions they are siphoning up in tax dollars for their phony models and ridiculous prognostications, not one of which has come true. And this is the last and most damning evidence of the lie, the absolutely stunning record of failed predictions over the last 30 years. A very important aspect of any scientific theory is that it must predict effects. When the predictions fail, the theory has been disproven.

text:
Greenhouse gases and the greenhouse effect appear to have very little impact on the Earth's surface temperature.
The assertion that the Earth would be 33¬∞K colder without Greenhouse Gases by IPCC reports seems to ignore atmospheric autocompression which accounts for nearly all of the 33¬∞K warming. This phenomenon explains the temperature of planets in the solar system (the ones with enough atmospheric pressure), including Venus where the temperature has been reported to be caused by a runaway greenhouse effect by many news organizations.

The greenhouse effect exists, but it has a very minor impact on surface temperature. Much smaller than what the IPCC reports claim. Temperature forcing by doubling CO2 concentrations is much lower than the range of 3-4.5¬∞K.

text: Hey, don't worry about all this. Part of what is stated in all these videos is based on science but fewer scientists are happy with blaming human emissions than previously. Since 1850 the planet has warmed around 0.8 of 1 degree. This was since 1850 which was before the industrial revolution.  The planet has not warmed further since 1999 hence we now call it climate change instead of previously global warming. I have a pic of a Sydney light house from 100 years ago and again a pic from last year, no change in sea level around its base.  In the 1970's, scientists were afraid of another mini ice age by near the year 2000. Then out steps Al Gore who spoke of global warming. Since his dire predictions in early 2003, nothing has changed. There are still storms, tornadoes, floods etc as much as ever. Well, NASA feel they are reducing but all the media jump on any global catastrophe as if every event points to climate change.  Polar bears are increasing in number, and interestingly, green house owners in Europe deliberately pump Co2 gas into their greenhouses to massively increase yield.  Plants love Co2. Scientists say we are actually well down on Co2 gas levels compared to the Jurassic and other periods when there was much more vegetation than we have today.  Was it NASA again, who say from satellite images that areas of the planet are becoming greener as Co2 levels rise.   There was a mini ice age in the mid ages, in London the river Thames used to freeze over every winter until 1802. Since then the planet has been warming. This was before the industrial age or large amounts of human population.  And again NASA, I read a lot of what they are seeing from outer space, they say most of our planets have been warming in the last 30 years due to a solar maximum. The sun is now entering a solar minimum so we can expect a little cooling of the planet. I say, follow the money and see what these climate change folk say we should do with our countries money supplies. Handing over billions to global elites is the aim of the game here it appears and not much else. China and India give the middle finger to all this reduction of emissions.

text: 100% of the temperature "readings" that are in the "Climate change" charts are from models that are parameterized around an assumption of a 3x multiplier of CO2 concentration to temperature change. There's one major, glaring issue with this. Clouds.  When temperature rises, water vaporizes. Those vapors climb up to the top of the troposphere and cool down due to the rapidly dissipating atmospheric pressure and condense into clouds. 40-60% of the radiation that they block is reflected back into space, providing a damping effect on the temperature. the ACTUAL amplifier of CO2 concentration to temperature increase, therefore, is 0.5x.  2019's global temperature is EXACTLY the same as it was in 1978 when they started measuring the temperature the most accurate way that we have devised thus far, via Satellite.  prior to 1978, there were FAR warmer periods, and many other colder periods.  36 of the 37 models produced by the "scientists" use the parameterized inputs with the assumptions that were disproved by recent measurements taken by weather balloons in 2018.  Arctic Sea Ice is increasing in thickness, but reducing in area. Antarctic sea ice is increasing in thickness AND area. the total net change in ice volume is 80 million tons/year increase. it has been steadily rising since 1931, where it was at a far lower volume than it is right now.  The other hypothesis of the "pause" in "Global Warming" (hence the name change that same year) is that the ocean was "consuming the heat". that was also disproven when they sent sensors from buoys into the depths. there was observed a linear decrease in temperature relative to depth, as it was with the weather balloons' measurements when they hypothesized that there were "hot-spots"  in the upper atmosphere, which were also disproven.  The Earth's Atmosphere is a self-balancing system and bucks the universal truth of increased entropy because of the SUN injecting 15,000X the necessary energy to maintain a constant system.

text: As of right now I don't have much knowledge on the subject of global warming and how (or if) humans are causing it, but right near the beginning of the video you make a suggestion that we aren't affecting the climate at all. At 0:56 you show a graph presenting the increase of temperature over the years while saying that the greenhouse gasses in the atmosphere have increased by more than a third. While that seems to indicate we are affecting it, you later say "While Earth's climate has fluctuated in the past, atmospheric carbon dioxide hasn't reached today's levels in hundreds of thousands of years." To me, who again knows nothing of the subject, you are saying that there's no connection between carbon dioxide levels and climate change. If the Earth's climate has been changing before we were even here, then how do we know that the levels of carbon dioxide are affecting the climate at all? Also, you say the levels have increased by more than a third, but more than a third doesn't tell me anything. How much was there to begin with? 1.33 multiplied by a small number still is a pretty small number. Was the level high enough to make "more than a third" have that much of an impact? As an innocent bystander, your argument for climate change being affected by the increase of carbon dioxide levels could have been done better.

text:
> Really? Well that is not shown in ANY of the Raw data available. it is only shown in computer generated models and NOWHERE ELSE

If thermometers are computer models sure? The only temperature reconstruction that didn't show warming was RSS which virtually every skeptic referred to and some still to this day. The only problem is that they'll refer to a 2015 version of RSS since it was discovered and verified by a skeptic that RSS which is based on satellite models for temperature had wrong values for the diurnal shift and since mid 2016 it has shown warming like every other reconstruction which uses thermometers. The great irony being that if you rely on RSS you rely on satellite models to estimate temperature and hope it's somehow more accurate than a thermometer.

I also find it interesting that people still use 1998 as the start point for this claim. It was near the highest solar maximum in recent history with the strongest El Nino on record meaning that no following year should even be close to it considering the sun has been less active since then if CO2 has such a little affect on the atmosphere, yet we're still beating 1998 for record global surface temperatures with a weaker sun.

author: Max Maxwell

text:
''There is much debate over whether the Medieval Warm Period was global in extent or not. The MWP is most clearly expressed in parts of North America, the North Atlantic and Europe and parts of Asia. For it to be global in extent the MWP would need to be seen clearly in more records from the tropical regions and the Southern Hemisphere. There are very few palaeoclimatic records for these latter two regions.
Of course, if the MWP was shown to be global in extent and as warm or warmer than today (based on an equivalent coverage over the NH and SH) then obviously the late-20th century warmth would not be unprecedented. On the other hand, if the MWP was global, but was less warm that today, then current warmth would be unprecedented.
We know from the instrumental temperature record that the two hemispheres do not always follow one another. We cannot, therefore, make the assumption that temperatures in the global average will be similar to those in the northern hemisphere.''

Phil Jones PhD CRU in response to a BBC question.

''unprecedented warming'' is a term used often in the climate creationists vocabulary and most people believe the lies...it is of no relevance whether peer reviewed papers state this as the policy makers are fed alarmist tripe continuously that has not been reviewed....ie the Himalayan glacier fiasco.

text:
Do you have a citation for this claim or just 'commonsense'?
Who said CO2 was a pollutant? It's the presence of CO2 in the atmosphere that affects global temperatures, it doesn't matter if its natural or poisonous. 
"The total number of CO2 molecules above our heads in the atmosphere is more important than their percentage in the atmosphere. If the amount of inert nitrogen gas (N2) in the atmosphere were to be cut in half then the percentage of CO2 would jump (to about 600 ppm; 0.06%) without a change in the absolute amount of CO2 and no substantial change in the energy balance of the Earth. Adding a huge number of energy-absorbing CO2 molecules to the atmosphere doesn‚Äôt change its percent number very much, only because it's being added to a vast inert N2 background."
"Saying that CO2 is "only a trace gas" is like saying that arsenic is "only" a trace water contaminant. Small amounts of very active substances can cause large effects."

text:
Most powerful greenhouse gas is water vapour,  is there any additional water vapor adding to earth's amosphere..even adds up, they condense and fall back to earth by seasonal cycles.... so the next most greenhouse gases to consider are co2 and CH4.... which are adding up in huge amounts in earth atmosphere due to burning fossil fuels and meat eaters... and climate scientists think the cause of global warming....because they stay in gaseous state all the time and trap reflected sun energy.

Also even Co2 is not causing global warming.... burning fossils fuels is not just about Co2...I agree Co2 is not pollutant...but they produce lot of harmful substances....

Coal combustion releases nitrogen oxides, sulfur dioxide, particulate matter (PM), mercury, and dozens of other substances known to be hazardous to human health.

Diesel common pollutants include unburned hydrocarbons (HC), carbon monoxide (CO), nitrogen oxides (NOx) or particulate matter (PM)

Petrol pollutants carbon monoxide, oxides of nitrogen, un-burnt hydrocarbons and particulate matter.

The problem is they all are air pollutants, not solid ones like coming out of batteries which can be stored and recycled efficiently...they all cause serious air pollution which we inhale daily...

Even CO2 is not causing global warming..we need to get away from fossil fuels and find alternative sources of energy..

 Pollution from fossil tech is at all levels i.e. extraction, tech manufacturing, transportation and while usage....Also it cannot be recycled easily...

Pollution from renewable tech is only at tech manufacturing level... we do not need to extract fuel and transport to run them (except batteries, which pollution is no comparison to fossil fuels)...it is readily available in earth's atmosphere...

EV's + Solar + wind and fusion power = clean energy future.. we all need to drive this.....

text:
The oceans are part of what is referred to as the CO2 sink. Humans add vast amounts of CO2 to this sink through burning fossil fuels, deforestation, etc, whilst not removing CO2 from the sink. Therefore the sink becomes out of balance and excess CO2 collects in the atmosphere, causing warming which further exacerbates the imbalance in the CO2 sink.
There are indeed many factors that affect Earth's climate. Scientists are smart people, and they've studied their area of expertise, that's why they can account for these factors in their modelling and research and determine that the current upward trend of global temperatures is caused predominantly by... human CO2 emissions.
Can you provide a source to show that none of predictions made by climate scientists in the 70s and 80s came true, or are you simply making a baseless assertion?

text:
¬†@Jdevilist¬† It's hilariously ironic how you consider yourself "woke," when the reality is that you're a pawn that's been brainwashed by the establishment that benefits from your continued ignorance. Climate change is a real phenomenon that is slowly destroying our ecosystem. Species are dying at a rate not seen since the extinction of the dinosaurs, and we can directly correlate the rapid increase in average global temperatures to the beginning of the industrial revolution, and through decades of scientific research we have come to understand not only the causal mechanisms which are responsible for this (the greenhouse gas effect), but we are witnessing the devastating effects that this has on the ecosystem. What's more, our resource depletion alongside pollution of the atmosphere AND the rapid extinction of numerous species do not each have their own separate and individual effects, but rather they are compounded and accelerate the severity of the situation. We are also seeing chain reactions occur in the ecosystem that are going to have severe effects on our resource production and standard of living. If nothing is done, we will witness the collapse our supply chains and agricultural system, and we will starve to death. 


We won't have to prove you and those like you wrong, the environment will do that for us when you and everyone you care about slowly starves to death. Don't be a sheep.

text: ¬†@Gian Silvestre¬† CO2 caused "catastrophic global warming" is false for several reasons. For starters, CO2 doesn't control the temperature of Earth. From 1945 to 1979 atm. CO2 shot up like a rocket while temps fell, therefore CO2 does not "drive the climate." Next issue, the Earth is historically cold right now, not historically hot. Search : "Global temperature and atmospheric CO2 over geologic time/graph/images" by Scotese and Berner. Also notice atmospheric CO2 is historically low right now, not historically high.
author: Rick TD

text:
¬†@Rick TD¬† This is absolutely incorrect. The evidence that human industrial activities are responsible for climate change is significant and solid. The last 50 years has helped us understand the greenhouse gas effect more effectively, and a review of the data demonstrates that there is a direct correlation between the average rise in temperatures on a global scale and the beginning of the industrial revolution. The amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere has reached a PPM of 409.8, far exceeding the carbon levels seen in the last 800,000 years and even the last 100 years. Humans did not evolve to survive in an environment like this, we are actively warming the atmosphere to temperatures that humans and huge numbers of species in general simply cannot survive in. 

You and other climate change deniers' insistence on ignoring the data and hindering sensible policies to invest in sustainable energy is going to be the downfall of human civilization. We cannot hope to survive the next 100 years without a serious and globally coordinated effort to reduce our greenhouse gas emissions to zero.
author: Professor Nebula

text:
Before people start blaming people as a whole, realize that humans have existed on the Earth for thousands of years without significantly impacting the environment until the past two centuries on the onset of mass industrialization and agriculture. So do not say humans are a cancer that do not deserve the Earth, but the problem is how we are living the modern life.

Human society is living with the highest standards in history, but the modern life comes with costs. Consumerism with one use products such as wrappers and boxes for the products some people take granted for creates a lot of trash. The electricity we use for all our mechanical processes are mostly created by burning fossil fuels (Renewable Energy such as solar can only do so much. . .). The Cars and computer that you use to live your modern life were created by factories that emit greenhouse gases and require the mining of resources that shift the surface.

Here is the hard truth. Consumerism and the modern life is a great life, but that comes with clear costs. If you truly want to save the Earth, then understand that the human race as a whole must sacrifice many of its wants and desires and basically live with less in order to leave a smaller environmental impact. Until people figure out a way to somehow collect and recycle all the waste created by constant buying, spending, and throwing away of our trash, this is the only realistic option if we want to protect the planet in the long run.

author: Big Gus

text:
+4 Tonnes of Fury
You're talking about climate changing. That's not the issue. Climate has been warming for centuries - since the Little Ice Age.  In 1801 Thomas Jefferson wrote, "A change in our climate however is taking place very sensibly." Sea level has been rising at the same rate since before the Lincoln administration. Glaciers have been receding for centuries. Greenland once was farmed. The Fertile Crescent was once fertile. 

Only science deniers claim that climate change is a new phenomenon. The anthropogenic climate change predictions said that the warming and sea level rise should have increased above the natural warming. Didn't happen.
author: George Applegate

text:
Yes, the climate always changes but you are oversimplifying the significance of the recent warming trend. The rate is unprecedented, the last 3 years have seen record highs in global average temperature and the overall upward trend since 1880 has the fingerprints of greenhouse gases all over it. CO2 has been steady since the end of the last ice age 10,000 years ago and is the primary greenhouse gas, even though methane is technically more potent.

""It is extremely likely [95 percent confidence] more than half of the observed increase in global average surface temperature from 1951 to 2010 was caused by the anthropogenic increase in greenhouse gas concentrations and other anthropogenic forcings together."
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/climate-consensus-97-per-cent/2013/sep/27/global-warming-ipcc-report-humans

Sea level will probably rise 3 feet by 2100 (best case scenario), after it level rose by only 6cm during the 19th century and 19cm in the 20th century. You are grasping at straws and spreading a lot of fake talking points.
http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/2008GL033611/full
author: alcom

text:
+alcom
The focus on "hottest year ever" speaks volumes. They should be saying that temperatures are rising as predicted, but instead focus on tiny warming as if that was all that was predicted. Was 1937 the warmest year on record at the time? Was 1947? 1917? This is how gradual warming works: every year is, on average, the warmest on record. Means nothing other than that the climate is warming, as it has for centuries. There is no evidence of an unprecedented rate, in fact the satellite record showed 18 years of no warming at all.

If the warming had "the fingerprints of greenhouse gases all over it," then the warming would have only begun in the latter half of the 20th century when atmospheric CO2 increased. It didn't. To quote Phil Jones in a 2010 BBC interview, "This recent warming trend was no different from others we have measured. The world warmed at the same rate in 1860-1880, 1919-1940, and 1975-1998." https://archive.fo/mlnuG/ed2f063ff371ff1dbf993c07d393dded8bb7fce2.jpg

Sea level rise remains unchanged:
https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/sltrends/sltrends_station.shtml?stnid=8724580 (Key West)
https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/sltrends/sltrends_station.shtml?stnid=8518750 (New York)
https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/sltrends/sltrends_global_station.htm?stnid=120-022 (Wismar, Germany)
These are just of few of the 60+ century-long tide gauges that show no increase due to CO2.
author: George Applegate

text:
The last 3 years being all-time records on top of a century of steady increases only reinforces the predicted pattern. The satellite record does not show there was "no warming for 18 years", it shows a record-breaking high in 1998 and steady moderate increases thereafter. If you remove the 1998 high as an anomaly, the whole "pause" is erased. Shame on you for repeating this denier garbage, you can't just cherry pick one favorite record high and ignore the rest of the trend.

The Hadley dataset is only made from surface-temperature readings. 95% of the sun's energy goes into the ocean, and the positive feedback from the blue Arctic as summer sea ice extent diminishes shows that the Arctic region is warming at twice the rate of the rest of the planet. Yet again you again attempt to obscure the bigger picture by presenting cherry-picked stats.
http://metro.co.uk/2017/08/14/climate-change-warning-sign-as-arctic-is-warming-twice-as-fast-as-rest-of-planet-6850656/

Tide gauge measurements are not as accurate as satellite readings. In addition, sea level rise is not uniform around the world. Again you cherry pick just 3 tiny anomalies to support your false narrative.
https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/sciencefair/2017/05/23/sea-level-rise-accelerating-study/102068034/
author: alcom

text:
+alcom
"The last 3 years being all-time records on top of a century of steady increases" You could have said the same thing in 1937.
No, 1998 was not "cherry picked." The length of the pause was calculated by going from the present backward until there was a positive trend. Before the most recent El Nino, that period was 18 years - not predicted by the models. Until Karl "fixed" the surface temperature history, the pause was also reflected in the Hadley and GISS datasets (which use the same weather station data). The IPCC acknowledged this.

The "the heat went into the deep ocean" is not plausible. The greenhouse effect operates through infrared back radiation, which will be absorbed in the first few millimeters of the ocean surface, so cannot heat the deep ocean. Greenhouse warming warms the atmosphere and then the surface. That didn't happen.

Did you not read what I said? ALL the century-long tide gauges show the same thing. You're citing the same "sea level rise doubled in 1993" nonsense that has been debunked, even by the authors of that study. The supposed "acceleration" (Church & White) was a comparison between the historic rate (to the present) of coastal sea level rise from tide gauges at 1.7mm/yr, and the satellite altimeter (launched in 1993) measured global  rate of SLR at 3mm/yr. They measure two different things, not that the rate magically doubled when satellites were launched. Church and White have since walked that back, but the alarmists won't let it go. Tide gauges are both more accurate and show century-long trends, which satellites cannot do. Look for yourself:

text:
¬†@PRYVTgomerPYLE¬† You should look into LFTR technology. Safe, minimal waste and short half-life for waste with the added benefit of being  proliferation  resistance for WMD's. Most people only see the standard pressurized water reactors using highly enriched uranium as the fissionable material, but thorium is a much safer technology and the fuel is more readily available. While I like other technologies better, having worked with nuclear reactors, I know most of the issues people have are from lacking knowledge about them.

The real threat comes from the consumption of animal products. The destruction of the rainforest to grow soy to feed to livestock, the trasportation of the feed and animals, and the waste is the biggest threat by far, exceeding all other contributers to global warming. Then there are the people who complain about government handouts like food stamps, but they buy milk that is 73% subsidised and meat where the feed and industry are subsidised and mooch off from everyone else while increasing health care costs.

text: First of all, climate change does not lead to more catastrophic weathers. Historically, the total amount of wildfires worldwide have decreased by 15% since 1950. And the Proceedings of the National Academy of Science of the United States of America said that ‚ÄúEstimates show that even with global warming, The level of wildfires will continue to decline until mid century.‚Äù (Bjorn Lomborg, The Wall Street Journal) Also the claim that droughts have increased from global warming, is also wrong. Yes, there are places in the world where droughts became more extreme, but there are also places where droughts have become weaker. A quote from the U.N. Climate Panel 2012: ‚ÄúSome regions of the world have experienced more intense and longer drought, in particular in Southern Europe and West Africa, but in some regions, droughts have become less frequent, less intense, or shorter, for example in central North America and Northwestern Australia.‚Äù Furthermore, a study published by Nature in March 2014 found that globally, droughts severity has not changed thru the years. Finally, a bar graph sourced by NOAA shows that although there has been a slight increase in major Atlantic hurricanes making landfall hitting in the US, the total number of hurricanes hitting Atlantic hurricanes making landfall hitting in the US have dropped a little less than 25% of what it was in the 1950s. The sea levels are rising, but the rise is not accelerating. A paper from Global and Planetary Change found that the rate of rise has slowed down: ‚ÄúIt is found that the GMSL rises with the rate of 3.2 ¬± 0.4 mm/yr during 1993‚Äì2003 and started decelerating since 2004 to a rate of 1.8 ¬± 0.9 mm/yr in 2012.‚Äù This shows that even with CO2 emissions from fossil fuels are accelerating, the sea levels from the oceans are not. We told that the effects of climate change is catastrophic, but that‚Äôs simply not true! We are told by people like Bill Nye that if we don't stop spewing carbon, the polar ice caps are going to completely melt and destroy numerous major cities would be flooded, but we not that this process is going to take 5000 years. "There are more than five million cubic miles of ice on Earth, and some scientists say it would take more than 5,000 years to melt it all." National Geographic. Policies are being pushed like the end of the world is coming in 100 years. All this shows that we shouldn't be freaking out because it‚Äôs simply not necessary.
